meanings.definition: To hinder or impede progress or movement.
meanings.sent1: Heavy traffic can hamper our journey to the park.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather did not hamper our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: Trying to run with untied shoelaces would certainly hamper your speed!
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure seemed to hamper her ability to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog hampered visibility on the road, making driving dangerous.

meanings.definition: A large basket with a lid used for storing or carrying items.
meanings.sent1: She packed her dirty laundry in the hamper.
meanings.sent2: The picnic hamper was filled with delicious sandwiches and fruits.
meanings.sent3: The hamper in the corner of the room overflowed with toys.
meanings.sent4: The hamper by the door held a collection of umbrellas and raincoats.
meanings.sent5: The hamper in the bathroom was full of fluffy towels and bathrobes.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture with shelves or compartments for storing clothes or linens.
meanings.sent1: The antique hamper in the bedroom was beautifully crafted.
meanings.sent2: She organized her linens neatly in the hamper.
meanings.sent3: The hamper in the hallway was a convenient storage solution.
meanings.sent4: The hamper in the closet had separate compartments for different types of clothing.
meanings.sent5: The hamper in the guest room was always stocked with fresh sheets and blankets.
